alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Appomattox; Bedford; Buckingham; Campbell; Rockbridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:26AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rain will impact portions of Appomattox, Rockbridge, northeastern Campbell, northeastern Bedford, western Buckingham, and Amherst Counties, the City of Buena Vista, the City of Lexington and the City of Lynchburg through 300 AM EDT... At 224 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of heavy showers and thunderstorms extending from near Collierstown to Goode to Bent Creek. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain could cause localized poor drainage flooding. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lynchburg... Lexington... Buena Vista... Amherst... Appomattox... Glasgow... and Forks Of Buffalo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
